meanings.definition: Text displayed on a computer or other electronic device that contains links to other text that the reader can access by clicking on the links.
meanings.sent1: I found interesting hypertext on the website that led me to more information.
meanings.sent2: The hypertext in the article allowed me to explore related topics easily.
meanings.sent3: The hypertext in the document was like a map guiding me to different sections.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a hypertext, with thoughts branching out like interconnected web pages.
meanings.sent5: The hypertext in the book made the content interactive and engaging.

meanings.definition: A software system that links topics on the screen to related information and graphics, which are typically accessed by clicking on a highlighted word or icon on the screen.
meanings.sent1: The hypertext program helped me navigate through the information effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: Using hypertext, I could quickly access additional details about the topic.
meanings.sent3: The hypertext software felt like a helpful guide pointing me in the right direction.
meanings.sent4: His brain seemed to function like a hypertext, connecting ideas seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The hypertext feature enhanced the user experience by providing easy access to resources.
